      • addClientTransaction

        public TransactionFrame addClientTransaction(java.lang.String stamp,
                                    java.lang.String stepInfo,
                                    java.lang.Object[] args,
                                    java.lang.Object result,
                                    long duration)
                                      throws com.itko.lisa.remote.plumbing.JMSInvocationException
        Overloaded for legacy reasons. See the next addClientTransaction method.
        Parameters:
        stamp -
        stepInfo -
        args -
        result -
        duration -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.itko.lisa.remote.plumbing.JMSInvocationException

      • addClientTransaction

        public TransactionFrame addClientTransaction(java.lang.String runId,
                                    java.util.Map runInfo,
                                    java.lang.String stamp,
                                    java.lang.String stepInfo,
                                    java.lang.Object[] args,
                                    java.lang.Object result,
                                    long duration)
                                      throws com.itko.lisa.remote.plumbing.JMSInvocationException
        As a client, you can invoke this method to root a transaction tree at a new client transaction created using the specified parameters. Note: you must call installSocketTracker before you initiate the client side transaction you're adding here and it is recommended you call uninstallSocketTracker after you're done with the network call.
        Parameters:
        runId - optionally a unique id
        runInfo - optionally some metadata about the client step
        stamp - optionally a unique id used to look up the frame after it's been persisted
        stepInfo - a nice human-readable string that tells what the transaction is doing (can be null)
        args - the parameters the client passes to the transaction (can be empty)
        result - the result of the transaction (can be null)
        duration - the client's view of the transaction duration
        Returns:
        the client frame generated
        Throws:
        com.itko.lisa.remote.plumbing.JMSInvocationException

      • getTransactionIds

        public int getTransactionIds(java.util.List<java.lang.String> resultList,
                    int offset,
                    int limit,
                    java.util.Date from,
                    java.util.Date to,
                    java.lang.String agentName,
                    int category,
                    java.lang.String clazz,
                    java.lang.String method,
                    java.lang.String sessionId,
                    long minDuration,
                    java.lang.String transactionId,
                    java.lang.String localIP,
                    java.lang.String remoteIP,
                    java.util.Map tags,
                    boolean sortAscending,
                    int maxRowRead)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method retrieves a list of transaction ids that satisfy the filters passed as arguments.
        Parameters:
        resultList -
        offset - starting point
        limit - max number of results
        from - search after this date (if not null)
        to - search before thie date (if not null)
        agentName - filter by agent name
        category - filter by transaction category (see TranactionFrame.CATEGORY_XXX - 0 for no filter)
        clazz - filter by class name (null or "" for no filter)
        method - filter by method name (null or "" for no filter)
        sessionId - filter by sessionId (null or "" for not filter)
        minDuration - filter by frame duration greater than minTime
        transactionId - filter by transaction id
        localIP - filter by local ip address (if not null or empty)
        remoteIP - filter by remote ip address (if not null or empty)
        sortAscending - true to sort results ascending by time, false to sort descending
        maxRowRead - limits the number of rows read from the database
        Returns:
        a list of transaction ids mathing the search criteria
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        public int getTransactionCount(java.util.Date from,
                      java.util.Date to,
                      java.lang.String agentName,

                      java.lang.String remoteIP,
                      java.util.Map tags)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method retrieves a list of transaction ids that satisfy the filters passed as arguments.
        Parameters:
        from - search after this date (if not null)
        to - search before thie date (if not null)
        agentName - filter by agent name
        category - filter by transaction category (see TranactionFrame.CATEGORY_XXX - 0 for no filter)
        clazz - filter by class name (null or "" for no filter)
        method - filter by method name (null or "" for no filter)
        sessionId - filter by sessionId (null or "" for not filter)
        minDuration - filter by frame duration greater than minTime
        remoteIP - filter by remote ip address (if not null or empty)
        Returns:
        a list of transaction ids matching the search criteria
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getTransactions

        public java.util.List<TransactionFrame> getTransactions(int offset,
                                               int limit,
                                               java.util.Date from,
                                               java.util.Date to,
                                               long[] agentIds,
                                               int category,
                                               java.lang.String clazz,
                                               java.lang.String method,
                                               java.lang.String sessionId,
                                               java.lang.String[] frameId,
                                               long minDuration,
                                               java.lang.String localIP,
                                               int localPort,
                                               java.lang.String remoteIP,
                                               int remotePort,
                                               boolean wantFilledRequestResponse,
                                               boolean rootsOnly)
                                                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets a flat list of TransactionFrame objects received from all agents that satisfy the filters passed as arguments Note: this always goes to the Database so even though we force a flush it may take a few seconds to get the most recent data
        Parameters:
        offset - offset
        limit - max number of results
        from - search after this date (or not if null)
        to - search before this date (or not if null)
        agentIds - filter by agent id (if not 0)
        category - filter by transaction category (see TranactionFrame.CATEGORY_XXX - 0 for no filter)
        clazz - filter by class name (null or "" for no filter)
        method - filter by method name (null or "" for no filter)
        sessionId - filter by sessionId (null or "" for not filter)
        frameId - a (possibly null or empty) array of frameId to select
        minDuration - filter by frame duration greater than minTime
        localIP - filter by local ip address if not null or empty
        localPort - filter by local port if not 0
        remoteIP - filter by remote ip address if not null or empty
        remotePort - filter by remote port if not 0
        wantFilledRequestResponse - indicate if you want the full request/response content
        Returns:
        a list of TransactionFrame objects satisfying the supplied criteria ordered by decreasing time TODO: implement offset/limit for Oracle, SQL Server, Derby, DB2
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getFrame

        public TransactionFrame getFrame(com.itko.lisa.remote.persist.TransactionSearch search,
                        com.itko.lisa.remote.persist.TransactionRetrieval retrieval)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is used to retrieve a single frame for the specified search criteria.
        Parameters:
        search - the search criteria to use.
        retrieval - the transaction data scope to control what gets included and fetched.
        Returns:
        the root frame (with all descendants) for the specified transaction.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getFrames

        public java.util.List<TransactionFrame> getFrames(com.itko.lisa.remote.persist.TransactionSearch search,
                                         com.itko.lisa.remote.persist.TransactionRetrieval scope)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method searches for transaction frames which match the specified search criteria. The scope will control how much data for each transaction is returned. The list returned will not have children populated; do that one at a time using getFullTree(String, TransactionDataScope);
        Parameters:
        search - the search criteria to use.
        scope - the transaction data scope to control what gets included and fetched.
        Returns:
        the list of matching frames.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
